summary: Production of oil and natural gas in federal waters generated about $90 billion in revenue for the government from 2006 through 2018. The Bureau of Ocean Energy Management leases exploration rights to companies and sets royalty rates on production. We found the bureau systematically underestimates the value of offshore oil and gas leases, resulting in the government collecting hundreds of millions of dollars less than...
title: Offshore Oil and Gas: Opportunities Exist to Better Ensure a Fair Return on Federal Resources
